thread.title: Shalane Flanagan Withdraws From 2017 Boston Marathon
thread.title_full: Shalane Flanagan Withdraws From 2017 Boston Marathon

title: Shalane Flanagan Withdraws From 2017 Boston Marathon
text:
Shalane Flanagan Withdraws From 2017 Boston Marathon By Ashley Lauretta Published 17 hours ago Shalane takes the lead at last year’s Boston Marathon. 
Shalane Flanagan has announced she will not be running this year’s Boston Marathon—her beloved hometown race—due to a recent injury. She took to Facebook to share the news and disappointment. Flanagan has run the Boston Marathon three times and has made it widely known that a goal of hers is to win the iconic marathon. 
Her post read: 
This injury comes after some huge performances in 2016, including finishing third at the U.S. Olympic Marathon Trials—in a dramatic race to the finish—and sixth at the Olympics in Rio. 
We join the running community in wishing Shalane a fast—and healthy—recovery and hope we get to see her toe the start line in Boston next year! Sign Up for the Women's Running Newsletter
